content.title: Pension To Widows And Destitute Women
content.department: Department of Social Justice and Empowerment
content.details: The Haryana Pension to Widows and Destitute Women Scheme was introduced in the year 1980-81. The aim of the scheme is to provide social security to women who are unable to sustain themselves with their own resources and are in need of financial assistance. The rate of pension has been increased over the years, currently set at ₹2500 per month.
eligibility: Women of age 18 years and above
Residing in Haryana State for the last one year
Own income from all sources below ₹2,00,000 per annum
Must fulfill at least one of the following conditions: Widow, Destitute without husband, parents, and son(s), or Destitute due to desertion or physical/mental incapacity.
exclusions: Women employed by any Government or Local/Statutory Body or any organization substantially financed by any Government or Local/Statutory Body
Women drawing pension or family pension from any Government source.
content.application_process: Applications can be made online through the E-Disha Center or Atal Seva Kendra. Online applications are accepted at https://saralharyana.gov.in/.
documents_required: Identity Proof – Aadhaar Card of the parents
Age Proof Certificate – Birth Certificate or Mark sheet
Death Certificate of Husband – For Widow

faqs.question: Who is eligible for widow pension in Haryana?
faqs.answer: This is a State scheme under which destitute or deserted women and widow of 18 years of age or above are given pension as per eligibility criteria laid down in the rules of the scheme.

faqs.question: Who is not eligible for widow pension?
faqs.answer: Only widow women below the poverty line are eligible to receive benefits under this yojana. The age of a woman must be between 18 to 60 years. If the widowed woman has remarried after the husband's death, she will not be eligible to receive benefits under this yojana.

faqs.question: Are applications for this scheme open throughout the year?
